trait.name: Dust Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sandstorm (Recharge 5-6)
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@h 13} ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn.
If the save is successful, the target takes half the slashing damage and is not blinded.

trait.name: Reflective Surface
entries: When the glass elemental is dealt radiant damage, its skin reflect half of that damage (rounded down) to a random creature within 30 ft.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Due to the elemental's glass form, its surface can become so clear that it becomes transparent. Even when the glass elemental is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a glass elemental that has neither moved nor attacked.

trait.name: Shatter
entries: When the glass elemental drops to 0 hit points, it shatters. Any creature within 5 ft. of the elemental must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d8 piercing damage from the shards. On a success, the creature takes half damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blinding Reflection (Recharge 5-6)
entries: If the elemental is in direct sunlight it can maximize its surface's reflective capabilities, emiting a blinding bright light. Any creature within a 30 ft. radius that can see the elemental must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 15). On a failure, that creature is blinded by the elemental for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end o each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
